forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 60. Southwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This afternoon in Downtown San Francisco brings a subtle interlude of partly sunny skies interspersed with a lingering chill that whispers of rain yet to come. As the golden hues of late afternoon engage in a fleeting dance with the clouds, the temperature hovers comfortably near sixty, tempered by a brisk southwest breeze. Although the chance of rain showers is modest, particularly before five, a light mist might tease the city, kissing the rooftops of homes and gliding over the bay with a gentle caress.

As twilight descends, expect the clouds to deepen into a steadfast blanket, transforming into a more assured promise of rain after eleven. With a low settling around fifty-three, it would be wise to don a light jacket, perhaps layered over a comfortable sweater—a perfect attire for those evening strolls, where vibrant reflections shimmer on wet pavement. The tranquil sounds of the city seem to lull in the dusk, suggesting activities that lean into the cozier aspects of urban life, perhaps exploring a hidden café or revisiting a favorite bookstore. As the city prepares for an evening of potential showers, a little warmth and a comforting cup of tea or coffee will serve as delightful companions to the unfolding season’s soft embrace.
